Package com.marcosavard.commons.types

Class Color

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.marcosavard.commons.types.Color
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public class Color
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Define a color in term of RGB (Red, Green and Blue) components. Provide method to blend colors, to calculate contrast of colors, to compute hue of a color, saturation and luminence of colors. This class is purely mathematical, thus it can be used in an environment like GWT (Google Widget Toolkit), where imports of AWT or Swing library is prohibited.
    Author:
    Marco
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • constrastWith

        public double constrastWith​(Color thatColor)
        Return the contrast (from 0.0 to 1.0) with that color
        Parameters:
        thatColor -
        Returns:
        contrast from 0.0 (no contrast) and 1.0 (full contrast)

      • getContrastColor

        public Color getContrastColor()
        Return black or white, depending which color gives the highest contrast. For instance, yellow.getContrastColor() gives black, while darkBlue.getContrastColor() gives white.
        Returns:
        Black or white

      • getComplimentaryColor

        public Color getComplimentaryColor()
        Return the complimentary color. For instance getComplimentaryColor(black) returns white.
        Returns:
        complimentary color.

      • blendWith

        public Color blendWith​(Color thatColor,
                       int thatPercent)
        Blend this color with that color
        Parameters:
        thatColor - the color to blend with
        thatPercent - the percentage of the color to blend (default value : 50)
        Returns:
        blended color

      • toHSB

        public float[] toHSB()
        Convert RGB components to HSB (hue, saturation, brightness)
        Returns:
        array of 3 numbers, representing the hue, saturation and brightness

      • getHue

        public int getHue()
        Get the hue of a color. Hue varies from red (0.0), green (120.0), ble (240.0) and red again (360.0).
        Returns:
        a number from 0.0 (red) to 360.0 (red)

        brightness

      • getCMYK

        public float[] getCMYK()
        Convert RGB to CMYK values. C is for cyan, M for magenta, Y for yellow.
        Returns:
        array of four numbers representing CMYK values
